byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Andrew E. Kramer and Alexandra Odynova from St. Petersburg, Russia; Nicola Clark from Paris; Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong; Eric Schmitt from Washington; Kareem Fahim from Cairo; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: Metrojet, charter company that operated Russian aircraft that crashed in Sinai Peninsula, killing all 224 people aboard, rules out mechanical or pilot error; Russian aviation officials reject statement, saying such conclusions are premature.
lead_paragraph: The Russian charter airline company that operated the flight ruled out mechanical or pilot error. The government said such conclusions were premature.

headline.main: Mystery Deepens Over Russian Plane Crash in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Russian Regulators Challenge Airline’s Assessment of Deadly Crash in Sinai

snippet: The Russian charter airline company that operated the flight ruled out mechanical or pilot error. The government said such conclusions were premature.
